critique: This executive order revokes several previous executive orders and makes a technical amendment to civil service rules. The revoked orders seem to focus on preventing online censorship, protecting monuments, rebranding foreign assistance, and building a national garden. Revoking these orders suggests a shift away from the policies they represent. The amendment to civil service rules updates the rules to reflect the elimination of Schedule F, which is related to the excepted service. Overall, the order seems to be undoing actions of a previous administration and making minor adjustments to civil service rules.
